title: Boston to spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars for White Stadium overhaul, Wu says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston will spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars to renovate White Stadium in Franklin Park, announced Mayor Michelle Wu.
Boston Legacy FC is contributing $190 million to the renovation, which includes building a grass field and other facilities.
Opponents have filed a lawsuit, claiming the project violates state law, and the case is with the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court.

title: Where will ‘underdog’ Patriots fans watch the Super Bowl in Seattle?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Boston Sports Fan Group of Seattle secured Shawn O'Donnell's Irish pub for Patriots fans on Super Bowl Sunday.
With no Dunkin' locations in Washington, Patriots fans face nostalgia challenges in Seattle, Starbucks' birthplace.
Shawn O'Donnell's pub features Sam Adams, a Patriots-themed cocktail, and contributes $2 to the Jimmy Fund per drink.

title: Waymo wants to expand into Boston. Massachusetts law isn’t ready.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Waymo plans to expand autonomous vehicle operations in Boston, pending approval from Massachusetts lawmakers for necessary legal framework.
State Rep. Dan Cahill filed legislation to establish safety and operational standards for autonomous vehicles in Massachusetts.
Concerns arise over Waymo's readiness for Boston's complex streets and impact on rideshare and taxi drivers' livelihoods.

title: Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Justin Herbert received one out of 50 first-place MVP votes, affecting the total vote differences among candidates.
Voter Sam Monson chose Herbert for MVP due to perceived high value despite the Chargers' poor offensive line performance.
Drake Maye had superior statistics and a better team record than Herbert, finishing closely behind Matthew Stafford in MVP voting.

title: Not Your Average Joe’s to close Watertown location after 27 years
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Not Your Average Joe's in Watertown will close on February 11 after 27 years at 55 Main St.
The closure follows the December 2025 shutdown of the Peabody location, as reported by Boston Restaurant Talk.
Not Your Average Joe’s still operates locations in Acton, Bedford, Norwell, Hyannis, Waltham, Westwood, and several other states.

title: The best movies on Netflix right now (February 2026)
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix offers a diverse list of films, ranging from recent additions to classics, in various genres like comedy, drama, and action.
Highlighted new releases include 'Ex Machina', 'Hell or High Water', and 'You've Got Mail', showcasing varied themes and styles.
Popular titles such as 'Erin Brockovich', 'The Irishman', and 'The Power of the Dog' provide a mix of biographical, crime, and western narratives.

title: Ayer man accused in racist confrontation hit with new charges tied to boat vandalism
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: David McPartlan, 67, accused of racist confrontation, faces new charges for allegedly ordering boat vandalism.
McPartlan reportedly instructed an employee to damage Sheron Brown's boat and threatened termination if he refused.
Bail was revoked after McPartlan violated a no-contact order; he remains held at Worcester County House of Correction.

title: This is the top Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Buffalo chicken dip is the most-searched Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts according to a Coffeeness analysis.
Coffeeness found buffalo chicken dip to be the top snack in 31 states nationwide, leading other popular choices.
In Massachusetts, pico de gallo was the most-searched healthy snack option for the Super Bowl.

title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
author: John Waller
bullets: Karoline Leavitt, White House press secretary, expressed support for the Patriots at a briefing, citing her New Hampshire roots.
President Trump, despite connections with Patriots owner Robert Kraft, has chosen not to predict the Super Bowl LX outcome.
Trump will not attend the Super Bowl, but will participate in a pre-game interview with Tom Llamas of NBC Nightly News.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: An arctic front is expected to bring snow to Boston late Friday through Saturday, with ocean enhancement near the coast.
Heavier snowfall of 4-6 inches could occur in eastern Massachusetts, with widespread amounts of 2-4 inches elsewhere.
Coastal areas might see 3-6 inches of snow due to localized ocean effect, with snow tapering off by Saturday evening.
